monogr.title: Anglorum lacrimæ : in a sad passion complayning the death of our late soueraigne Lady Queene Elizabeth: yet comforted againe by the vertuous hopes of our most royall and renowned King Iames: whose Maiestie God long continue
monogr.author: Rogers, Thomas

div.head: To the right Honorable ROBERT LEE, Lord Maior of the Honorable Citie of London, and to the right Worshipfull the Knights and Aldermen of the same: health and happinesse long to continue.
div.p: RIght Honorable, and Worshipfull of this Cittie, being ouerpressed with the heauie burthen of Sorrow, and almost ouercome with griefe, for the losse of our late deceassed Queene; whom both you, and all others, sustaines a part: I am in dutie bound (in the behalfe of many thousandes) to giue a sad farewell to her Excellencie; the onely and last seruice that a Subiectes true hart can bestow. Vouchsafe therefore (Right Honorable and Worshipfull) as a memoriall of your late loue to her Maiestie, to Patronize these tearefull Lines: and then no doubt, but Anglorum Lacrimae will be comforted with Anglorum Gaudia, being guyded by the vertues of our gracious King: vnder whose Royall gouernment, all England is made happie, and a golden time is brought vnto our Countrey.

closer.signed: Yours in all duetie to be commaunded, a poore Freeman of this Cittie, Richard Iohnson.
